content.description:
We dropped in to the corner about 50' from base and traversed to a tree on the open left side. Set a belay. Wander up face to small roof then toward corner for gear. Proceed up corner past a couple of bushes to good tiered ledges set belay, 5.6.

At this point, we did a short lead up the wall on right to a tree and TR the 10+ crack 20' back down the corner.

Continue second pitch up corner to double roof exit on the right past 2 chockstones, 5.6.
content.location: As you drive past CR 47 the entrance to Big Elk bouldering the corner will come into view on your left when heading toward Estes Park. Continue for 0.7 miles to a pullout on the left. Hike uphill for 0.8 miles on the right side until you are able to traverse left to base or near base of corner.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
